info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 12:08PM CDT until June 12 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Chambers, Galveston, Harris and Liberty.
* WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1205 PM CDT, Doppler radar shows between 3.5 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. The public reported flooding in the warned area with water in homes in Crosby. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pasadena, eastern Pearland, northern League City, Baytown, northern Friendswood, La Porte, Deer Park, South Houston, Seabrook, Galena Park, Jacinto City, Webster, Kemah, Highlands, Channelview, Barrett, Cloverleaf, Clear Lake, South Belt / Ellington and Greater Hobby Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Chambers, TX; Galveston, TX; Harris, TX; Liberty, TX
